text: On February 15, 2022, intense rainfall in Petrópolis, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, caused mudslides and flooding that destroyed parts of the city. At least 176 people died in the disaster. President Jair Bolsonaro showed his support for the city and said he would visit after his visit to Russia. The Brazilian federal government also announced that it would give R$2.3 million to the city. ==References== Category:2022 disasters Category:2020s disasters in South America Category:2022 in Brazil Category:February 2022 events Category:Petrópolis
